result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. JEFFREY D ROCKMAN

defendant.name: ROCKMAN, JEFFREY D
defendant.address: N7338 Ho Chunk Rd, Wittenberg, WI 54499

records.addlTxt:
Signature bond effective 10/17/2022 @ 8 a.m. for treatment program purposes only. Transport to treatment facility by Human Services Department staff member. No stopping along the way. Treatment facility to provide proof to the court of arrival. Unless a new order is entered by the  court extending this signature bond, bond converts back to cash bond upon successful completion of treatment and Defendant must return back to the jail. If defendant walks away or is revoked from the treatment center, signature bond is revoked and converts back to cash bond. Failure by the defendant to follow these terms can result in the court authorizing a warrant. 

No contact with Richanda James.  Absolute sobriety, no illegal drugs, only prescription medication with a valid prescription. No entry into any Class B licensed establishments. No travel outside the state without prior court approval. No contact with known drug users or dealers except in a treatment setting.
Final pre-trial on December 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:41 AM Defendant JEFFREY D ROCKMAN appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Kolell in court for JEFFREY D ROCKMAN.  Attorney Gregory A. Parker in court for State of Wisconsin. Bond modification was filed.  Remarks by Atty. Kolell asking for another FPT, awaiting an offer.  Defendant has a treatment date upcoming for 28 day program.  Further remarks by Atty. Kolell.  Court will tentatively approve the bond modification effective 8 a.m. Monday upon proof of bed.  Signature bond (same conditions) along with Transport to treatment facility by human services staff member.  No stopping along the way.  Treatment facility to provide proof to the court of arrival.  Bond converts back to cash bond upon successful completion of treatment and return to jail, defendant walks away or is revoked from the center.

1:15 PM Defendant JEFFREY D ROCKMAN appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Kolell in court for JEFFREY D ROCKMAN.  Prosecuting attorney Gregory A. Parker in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Motion to modify the bond is denied.  Was reduced about 20 days ago.
Motion hearing on August 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:18 PM . Prosecuting attorney Gregory A. Parker in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant JEFFREY D ROCKMAN appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Kolell appeared by video for JEFFREY D ROCKMAN. Defendant qualifies for public defender services.  Remarks by Atty. Parker requesting a $2,500.00 cash bond w/conditions.  Response by Atty. Kolell.  Court makes its findings and sets bond at $2,500 cash with conditions requested.  Defense requests a preliminary hearing within time limits.
